diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Acute pancreatitis, alcoholic; Alcoholic Hepatitis; Pancreatic mass, suspected adenocarcinoma; Alcohol abuse
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: Patient presented with severe abdominal pain, nausea, and vomiting, along with a past medical history of alcohol use disorder. Imaging revealed a subtly hypoenhancing mass in the pancreas head, associated with dilatation of the upstream main pancreatic duct and atrophy of the pancreas body and tail. These findings, along with clinical history, supported the diagnosis of acute pancreatitis and a suspected pancreatic adenocarcinoma.
